WW.Rest.Label: Rest
WW.Rest.Msg: Resting allows you to heal damage and regain expended resources. If you have uninterrupted rest for 8 consecutive hours, you heal all damage, and you regain Health equal one-tenth your normal Health score (round down). Some of your other resources might also be replenished after a rest. If you stop resting to use an action or reaction, the time you have spent continuously resting is wasted and you must start resting again to gain any benefit from doing so.
WW.Rest.Confirm: Are you able to rest now?

WW.Roll.Label: Roll
WW.Roll.AgainstWrn: Nothing selected to roll against. Please select Defense or an attribute to roll against in the Weapon's Automation & Effects tab.

WW.Targeting.Label: Targeting

Dialog.SelectTargets: Please select one or more tokens to target.

WW.Targeting.TalentTargeted: Select targets and use trait or talent
WW.Targeting.TalentUntargeted: Use trait or talent without a target

Delete.Label: Delete
Delete.Title: Delete Item
Delete.Confirm: Are you sure you want to delete

WW.Name: Name
WW.ConditionPH: when a creature in your zone makes an attribute roll

WW.Attack.RiderPH: **20+:** The target takes an extra 1d6 damage.

WW.Weapon.Label: Weapon
WW.Weapon.Fire: Click to fire the loaded weapon.

Ammunition.Label: Ammunition
Ammunition.Tip: You must have at least one piece of ammunition of the indicated kind to attack with this weapon. Ammunition, and a container to hold it (such as a quiver, case, or bag), is included in the weapon’s price. You can recover spent ammunition after combat and make replacements while you rest. You can make melee attacks with a weapon that has this property, but it counts as an improvised weapon.

Brutal.Label: Brutal
Brutal.Tip: When you get a success on a roll to attack with this weapon, you can reroll each d6 of damage that comes up as a 1 once. You must use the second roll, even if it is another 1.

Firearm.Label: Firearm
Firearm.Tip: If a firearm comes into contact with water, it cannot be fired until dried and cleaned. Cleaning the weapon takes 1 hour using a tool kit and a pint of oil. Attacks with the firearm create loud noise. If the result of your roll to attack with the firearm is 5 or less, the weapon misfires. It takes 1 minute of work to repair and reload the weapon, which must be done before it can be used again.

Forceful.Label: Forceful
Forceful.Tip: When you get a critical success on a roll to attack with this weapon, you force the target to make an Agility roll. On a failure, the target falls prone. In addition, if the target is your Size or smaller, you push it up to 5 yards.

Long.Label: Long
Long.Tip: When you choose targets for your attacks using this weapon, increase your reach by 1.

Nimble.Label: Nimble
Nimble.Tip: You can use Agility in place of Strength for rolls to attack with this weapon.

Precise.Label: Precise
Precise.Tip: You roll to attack with this weapon with 1 boon.

Range.Label: Range
Range.Tip: You make ranged attacks with this weapon. You choose your targets within the listed number of yards from you.

Sharp.Label: Sharp
Sharp.Tip: When you get a critical success on an attack made using this weapon, you can roll twice for damage and use the higher amount.

Shattering.Label: Shattering
Shattering.Tip: When you get a critical success on a roll to attack a creature with this weapon, you force the target to make a Strength roll. On a failure, the target becomes weakened until the end of the next round. In addition, your attack with this weapon deals an extra 1d6 damage to target objects.

Special.Label: Special
Special.Tip: This weapon has a special property detailed in its description.

Thrown.Label: Thrown
Thrown.Tip: You can make a ranged attack with this weapon by throwing it. The number indicates the weapon’s maximum range in yards. When you throw a weapon, you make a Strength roll unless the weapon also has the Nimble property.

Versatile.Label: Versatile
Versatile.Tip: If you wield this weapon with both hands, your attacks with it deal an extra 1d6 damage.

Disarming.Label: Disarming
Disarming.Tip: You ignore the bane imposed on your roll to disarm a target when using this weapon.

Disrupting.Label: Disrupting
Disrupting.Tip: When you successfully make a disrupting attack, the result of your roll merely has to equal or exceed the target’s Will.

Driving.Label: Driving
Driving.Tip: When you perform the driving attack option with this weapon, you roll an additional d20 and use the highest result.

Guarding.Label: Guarding
Guarding.Tip: You can make a guarded attack while wielding this weapon, even if you don’t have a shield equipped.

Lunging.Label: Lunging
Lunging.Tip: You can make a lunging attack with this weapon without ignoring the weapon’s damage.

Pressing.Label: Pressing
Pressing.Tip: When you successfully make a pressing attack with this weapon, the result of your roll merely has to equal or exceed the target’s Agility.

Fixed.Label: Fixed
Fixed.Tip: Attacks made using this weapon ignore any effect that would enable it to deal extra damage or bonus damage.

Light.Label: Light
Light.Tip: When you would apply bonus damage to attacks made using this weapon, you apply one die fewer.

Reload.Label: Reload
Reload.Tip: You must use an action to load this weapon before you can attack with it.

Slow.Label: Slow
Slow.Tip: This trait prevents you from making multiple attacks with the weapon.

BoonsAgainst.Header: Grant Boons on rolls against self
BoonsAgainst.Defense: Boons to rolls against your Defense +
BoonsAgainst.Strength: Boons to rolls against your Strength +
BoonsAgainst.Agility: Boons to rolls against your Agility +
BoonsAgainst.Intellect: Boons to rolls against your Intellect +
BoonsAgainst.Will: Boons to rolls against your Will +

BanesAgainst.Header: Grant Banes on rolls against self
BanesAgainst.Defense: Banes to rolls against your Defense +
BanesAgainst.Strength: Banes to rolls against your Strength +
BanesAgainst.Agility: Banes to rolls against your Agility +
BanesAgainst.Intellect: Banes to rolls against your Intellect +
BanesAgainst.Will: Banes to rolls against your Will +

ExtraDamage.Dice: Increase the number of extra Damage dice by

Speed.Override: Speed drops to and cannot be increased above

UpgradeAttribute.Header: Set the Attribute Score, if not higher

DowngradeAttribute.Header: Set the Attribute Score, if not lower

Combat.1Round: Until the end of the round
Combat.2Rounds: Until the end of the next round
Combat.TurnEnd: Until the end of the trigger's turn
Combat.NextTriggerTurnStart: Until the start of the trigger's next turn
Combat.NextTargetTurnStart: Until the start of the target's next turn
Combat.NextTriggerTurnEnd: Until the end of the trigger's next turn
Combat.NextTargetTurnEnd: Until the end of the target's next turn

OutOfCombat.Header: Tracked with Time Units (Out of Combat)

WW.Affliction.BlindedDesc: You cannot see and thus have line of sight to nothing. If you want to attack or interact with anything, you must guess the target’s location or locate the target using other senses, which usually means you make the roll with 3 banes. You cannot make use of reactions that rely on sight. Finally, your Speed is halved.
WW.Affliction.ConfusedDesc: You become unable to make sense of what is happening around you. You cannot use reactions, you grant 1 boon on rolls against you, and you make Intellect and Will rolls with 1 bane.
WW.Affliction.ControlledDesc: You fall under the control of the source of this affliction. You take your turn when your controller does and it decides what you do, using your traits, talents, and spells. If you have already taken a turn when you gain this affliction, you take a turn as described during the next round. While controlled, you regard the source of the affliction as an ally.
WW.Affliction.CursedDesc: You make luck rolls with 1 bane.
WW.Affliction.DeafenedDesc: You cannot hear. You cannot make use of reactions that rely on hearing and are not subject to effects that depend on hearing.
WW.Affliction.FrightenedDesc: You fear the source of this affliction—a creature, an object, a space, or something else. While you have line of sight to the source of your fear, you make attribute rolls with 1 bane, and you grant 1 boon on attribute rolls against you.
WW.Affliction.HeldDesc: Your Speed drops to 0 and you cannot benefit from increases to your Speed until this affliction ends.
WW.Affliction.ImpairedDesc: The impaired affliction affects the attribute specified by the harmful effect, so you might be Strength impaired or Intellect impaired, for instance. You roll with 1 bane when using the specified attribute, and you grant 1 boon on rolls against the specified attribute.
WW.Affliction.OnFireDesc: An effect might make you catch fire. You take 1d6 damage at the end of each round until the fire is extinguished, normally with a successful luck roll. You can also use an action to overcome the flames by making a successful Agility roll, douse the flames with water, or smother them with a blanket or similar object. A creature that drops prone before trying to overcome the flames makes the roll with 1 boon.
WW.Affliction.PoisonedDesc: You have been exposed to venom, poison, or some other toxin. You make attribute rolls with 1 bane, and you grant 1 boon on rolls against you. In addition, at the end of each round, you lose 1d6 Health.
WW.Affliction.ProneDesc: You are lying on the ground. You cannot use reactions. You grant 1 boon on rolls made to attack you with melee weapons, but impose 1 bane on rolls made to attack you with ranged weapons. You can use your move only to crawl or stand up.
WW.Affliction.StunnedDesc: You cannot use actions or reactions. Your Speed drops to 0 and you cannot benefit from increases to Speed until this affliction ends. You grant 2 boons on rolls against you, and you make attribute rolls with 2 banes.
WW.Affliction.UnconsciousDesc: You cannot use actions or reactions. Your Speed drops to 0 and you cannot benefit from increases to Speed. You receive no information from your senses. You grant 3 boons on rolls against you, and you automatically fail all attribute rolls.
WW.Affliction.AsleepDesc: If you are unconscious because you are sleeping naturally, you stop being unconscious when a creature uses an action to shake you, kick you, or do something else to waken you. A loud noise might remove the affliction if you succeed on a luck roll. Time spent sleeping counts as resting for the purpose of healing damage. If your sleep is uninterrupted, you wake up naturally whenever you choose after you fall asleep.
WW.Affliction.WeakenedDesc: You make Strength and Agility rolls with 1 bane, and you grant 1 boon on rolls against your Strength and Agility. In addition, your Speed is halved and you cannot benefit from increases to your Speed.

TakingInit.Title: Taking the Initiative
TakingInit.Msg2: Do you want to use a reaction to take the initiative, instead of making a regular turn?
TakingInit.NoCharacter: A new round started, but you don't have a character assigned to you.

ActAgain.Title: Act Again
ActAgain.Msg: You already took a turn during this round. Normally, each combatant can take one turn per round ONCE.
ActAgain.Confirm: Are you sure you can act again during this round?

ActNext.Title: Act Next Turn
ActNext.Msg: You are going to take a turn next, once the current turn is over.

WW.Combat.SkipActedHint: Automatically bypass combatants who acted already during this round.

Migration.Started: Outdated data found. Please wait until the data migration is finished.
Migration.Forced: Forced data migration started. Please wait until the data migration is finished.
Migration.Finished: Data migration successful. Enjoy your game!

Character.Title: Character Sheet
Character.Description: A Tour for Shadow of the Weird Wizard's Character Sheet.
Character.SheetContent:
To start off, you'll need character sheets for your players and NPCs.
Here is the character sheet used by player characters. This digital sheet, like its physical counterparts, is where you write all the information about a character.
Character.HeaderContent: In the sheet's header, you can find the character's name and image, as well as the attributes and other basic statistics such as Defense and Health.
Character.AttributesContent:
Attributes are displayed with the score (absolute number) and its modifier next to it (signaled with + or -).
By clicking on the modifier, you can make an attribute roll.
Character.DefenseContent:
Defense is calculated automatically for characters, so you cannot edit it here. This will be explained later in the Equipment tab.
You can, however, hover your Defense score to see your Natural Defense.
Character.HealthContent:
Your Damage total and current Health are displayed here.
You can hover your current Health to see your normal Health score, without any loss or bonus.
In addition, you can edit your health by clicking on the Edit button.
Finally, when you are Injured or Incapacitated, an icon will be shown here to indicate it.
Character.LuckContent: You can make luck rolls by clicking on the d20 button below Luck.
Character.RestContent:
Finally, you can initiate a rest by clicking on the bed button under the bed.
There is a confirmation window to make sure you do not trigger rest by mistake!
Character.TabsContent:
All sheets, including this character sheet and the NPC, equipment, talent and spell sheets, have navigation tabs you can click to change what is displayed.
Simply click on them to check what is shown below.
Character.SummaryContent:
The first and default opened tab is the Summary. Here, you can find most information about a character condensed in a single space.
The Summary was built with combat encounters in mind, so you'll rarely need to go to another tab while in combat.
However, almost everything is edited in the other tabs, as shown later in this tour. The Summary is used to display information, not to edit them.
Character.AttacksContent: The creature's available attacks are found in this list of items. They display information about the attack similar to the Enemies and Allies chapter in Secrets of the Weird Wizard.
Character.RollContent: You can click on the name of the attack to trigger an Attribute or Luck roll. This is also true for traits, talents and spells displayed in the Summary tab.
Character.EditContent: You can click on the Edit button to open the corresponding item's sheet. Items will are detailed in another tour.
Character.ScrollContent:
The scroll button has two functionalities for attacks:
- When you hover it, the weapon's description is shown on a tooltip.
- When you click on it, you send the weapon's description to the chat.
Character.DamageRollContent: The damage button, as expected, allow you to roll damage dice when clicked.
Character.PropertiesContent: This text section indicates the weapon's intended grip (Off, One, Two) and its Properties, if any.
Character.ModifierContent:
This text section indicates the weapon's attribute and modifier used on the attribute rolls.
If the weapon was set to roll with any boons or banes by default, it's also displayed here.
Character.DamageContent: This text section indicates how much base damage the weapon does before any extra damage is applied.
Character.TalentContent:
This list shows all the creatures' Traits and Talents.
Like other items listed in the Summary, you can click on their names to make an attribute or luck roll, or on a button to trigger the corresponding functionality.
Optionally, you can assign a trait or talent's type to Action or Reaction to show them here separately.
Character.UsesContent:
Traits and talents that have uses or tokens have their uses/tokens represented by circles here.
You can click a an empty circle to spend an use, or a circle marked with a X to recover the use.
Character.EffectContent:
Traits, talents and spells can have Active Effects on them that modifies the character's stats. By clicking on this button, you can be toggle them on or off.
Effects are explained in details in their own tour.
Character.SpellContent:
This list shows your discovered Traditions as wells the Spells you learned.
It has the same functionality as attacks, traits and talents, including circles to track the spell's castings.
Character.StatsContent:
The character's main stats are edited in this tab.
Simply go to the corresponding field and click to edit it.
Character.DetailsContent:
The character's details are found on this tab.
You can click on a text box to enable to text editor.
Once done, click on the save button in the editor.
Character.EquipmentContent: The Equipment tab displays all the character's possessions, including coins, armor, weapons and other equipment.
Character.CoinsContent:
Your coins used for currency is displayed here.
Gold coins (gp), silver coins (sp) and copper coins (cp) are separated.
Character.WeightContent:
Your total weight from equipment you carry is automatically calculated and displayed here.
The maximum value is your Strength score.
When you go above this value, the text turns red.
Character.WeaponsContent:
Your weapons are displayed here along with details about their Damage, Grip and Properties.
Like in the Summary, you can use the buttons for functionality here.
Character.OtherContent:
All your Equipment besides coins are displayed in this list.
Weight and Uses or Charges are also tracked and displayed.
Character.EquipContent:
You can enable an equipment's effects by clicking on this button.
For example, an Armor set equipped should toggle this on.
Character.TalentsContent:
Your traits and talents have a dedicated list in this tab, with buttons for functionality being displayed.
In addition, the Source of the trait or talent is also displayed.
Character.SpellsContent:
The spells tab show your discovered Traditions. And lists your spells.
Relevant information such as Tier, Tradition and Castings are also displayed.
Character.EffectsContent: The effects tab is where all effects relevant to the actor is located, be them currently applied to them or not.
Character.AfflictionsContent:
Afflictions can be toggled on or off here by clicking each button.
Afflictions can also be toggled directly on the character's by right clicking on it.
Character.RemoveContent: This powerful button can be used to remove all afflictions the character has.
Character.AllContent: In this section, all effects relevant to the character are listed, broken down in three categories: Temporary Effects, Permanent Effects and Inactive Effects.
Character.TemporaryContent: Ongoing Active Effects with a set duration are listed here.
Character.PermanentContent: Active Effects without a duration are listed here.
Character.InactiveContent: Effects currently not active are listed here.

NPC.Title: NPC Sheet
NPC.Description: A Tour for Shadow of the Weird Wizard's NPC Sheet.
NPC.SheetContent:
NPC sheets are simplified version of character sheets, similar to entries found in the Enemies and Allies chapters of Secrets of the Weird Wizard.
All information about a NPC can be stored in this sheet.
If you stil didn't do the Character Sheet tour, we recommend you to start with it, then go back to this one.
NPC.SummaryContent:
Like in the character sheet, the Summary has everything you need to use NPCs.
However, most of the information is editable in the Stats tab only.
NPC.HeaderContent: The header of the statbox emulates the Enemies and Allies entries: they display the creature's level, type and if it's a Solitary enemy.
NPC.StatboxContent: The left side statbox shows the basic stats of the enemy, as well as any aura, traits and talents.
NPC.TalentsContent: This section lists all passive traits and talents the creature has.
NPC.ButtonsContent: Like in the character sheet, NPCs also have buttons on item lists that allow you to do a plethora of things.
NPC.AttacksContent: The creature's list of attacks is found here, displayed exactly like in the book.
NPC.ActionsContent:
Actions, reactions and end of the round effects will show here if any of them are present.
If the category is empty, the header is absent.
NPC.FuryContent: Enemies with a Fury entry has a dedicated section for them here.
NPC.DescriptionContent: The Description tab can store all information about the enemy, be it from the Enemies and Allies chapter or anything you want.
NPC.StatsContent:
The Stats tab is used to edit what's shown in the Summary.
Look for the information you want to edit and it will reflect in the Summary tab.
NPC.EffectsContent:
The Effects tab is the exactly same as the one present in the character sheet.
For more information about how to use it, see the Character Sheet and Effects tours.

Menu.RoundHour: Round time to a full hour. Rounded up if half a hour already passed, or down if not.

Settings.Label: Settings
Settings.PreciseSkipHint: When enabled, tracks the exact amount of time passed. When disabled time segments (hours, days, weeks, months) are rounded to the next whole number.
Settings.SkipRefHint: The time, in 24 hours format, used as reference when skipping days/weeks/months. The following day will start at the reference time.
Settings.SunriseHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when a sunrise happens.
Settings.MiddayHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when the sun is 90° towards the ground.
Settings.SunsetHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when a sunset happens.
Settings.MidnightHint: The time, in 24 hours format, indicating when the sun is 90° towards the ground.

Reset.Label: Reset
Reset.Title: Reset tracking
Reset.Msg: All tracked time will be reset. Once reset, the value cannot be restored by the application.
Reset.Confirm: Are you sure you want to reset the tracker?
